title: Drunken Shrimp
steps: Rinse the shrimp under running water.
Put shrimp in a deep bowl and pour in rice wine to cover.
Immediately cover the bowl (shrimp will be hopping around if live).
Allow shrimp to drink wine for 15 minutes (or until they stop moving).
Put a medium pot of water to boil. Add ginger slices.
Once boiling, add all shrimp at once and stir a couple times.
When water reboils, cook for 1½ minutes more.
Immediately use strainer to scoop shrimp out of water onto your plate.
Serve immediately with soy sauce for dipping if desired.
notes: Volume conversions: 250ml rice wine ≈ 250g, 2 ginger slices ≈ 10g
Live shrimp preferred for traditional preparation
Shrimp is cooked very briefly to maintain tender texture
Traditional Chinese dish where shrimp are intoxicated with wine before cooking
